title: David De Gea set to miss Liverpool clash as Man Utd wait to discover extent of injury
text:

David De Gea’s groin injury is not understood to be serious - but is still likely to keep him out of Manchester United ’s clash with Liverpool this weekend.

De Gea suffered the injury in the second-half of Spain’s 1-1 draw with Sweden in a Euro 2020 qualifier on Tuesday night, forcing him out of the game.

The United goalkeeper will undergo a scan and full assessment in Manchester on Wednesday, but the early indication from those close to the 29-year-old is that it is not a serious issue.

However, a groin strain, rather than a full muscle tear, could see De Gea sidelined for several weeks, ruling him out of Sunday’s visit of league leaders Liverpool, as well as next week’s Europa League tie away to Partizan Belgrade, the Premier League trio to Norwich and United’s EFL Cup tie away to Chelsea .

(Image: Anders Wiklund/TT/EPA-EFE/REX)

Sergio Romero, United’s No.2, will step in to replace De Gea, with third-choice Lee Grant making the step up to the bench as cover.

United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will be hoping the injury is not serious, with a crunch clash against leaders Liverpool at Old Trafford just five days away.

Asked about the injury in his post-match press conference, Spain boss Robert Moreno said: "He had pain in the abductor muscle but he received treatment at half-time and wanted to keep playing. He gave us his word, but in the end he couldn't continue."

(Image: TT News Agency/AFP via Getty Ima)

Spain were behind at the time of De Gea's departure thanks to Marcus Berg's goal 10 minutes earlier but substitute Rodrigo poked home from close range in stoppage time to seal the point that Spain needed to confirm their place at Euro 2020.

United, meanwhile, are currently just two points above the relegation zone and in desperate need of a result against the Reds, who are unbeaten in their opening eight fixtures.

To make matters worse for United, table toppers Liverpool, who are aiming to continue their 100 per cent start to the season, are expected to welcome first choice Alisson back after his injury.
